summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a victim, identified as 'Jane Doe 1', detailing her grooming and sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell beginning when she was 13 years old. The document describes the initial meeting, pattern of abuse, financial payments, travel to various properties, and involvement of other individuals.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central accused individual who groomed and sexually abused the victim from age 13, provided her money, arranged travel, and introduced her to associates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate who participated in the grooming and sexual abuse of the victim, acted as an executive assistant managing travel and appointments.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Identified as an assistant to Maxwell and Epstein who helped set up appointments and travel for the victim.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Met by the victim when Epstein took her to Mar-A-Lago; Epstein introduced her to Trump.

persons.name: Mike Wallace
persons.context: Mentioned as having a birthday party attended by Epstein and a blonde woman introduced as his girlfriend.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's brother, mentioned as having flown on Epstein's plane.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as having flown on Epstein's plane.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Introduced to the victim by Epstein at a party; Epstein later called Weinstein about auditions.

persons.name: Adam Perry Lang
persons.context: Epstein's chef who traveled with him.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who contacted the victim claiming she owed Epstein money for a co-signed apartment and handled school paperwork.

connections.description: Partners in grooming and sexually abusing the victim; Maxwell acted as Epstein's executive assistant and participated in the abuse.
Epstein groomed and sexually abused the victim from age 13, gave her money, and controlled aspects of her life.
Maxwell participated in the grooming and sexual abuse, acted as a 'big sister' figure initially, and managed the victim's appointments.
Groff was Maxwell's assistant who helped with scheduling and travel arrangements.
Indyke acted as Epstein's attorney, contacting the victim about financial matters and handling school paperwork.
Epstein took the victim to meet Trump at Mar-A-Lago, indicating a social acquaintance.

events.title: Initial Meeting and Grooming
events.description: The victim, age 13, met Epstein and Maxwell at a school camp in Michigan. Epstein offered scholarships and mentorship, beginning the grooming process.

events.title: First Sexual Abuse Incident
events.description: Epstein took the victim, age 14, to a pool house alone, masturbated in front of her, and made inappropriate comments about photographers.

events.title: Travel to New York and Shopping
events.description: The victim, age 14, flew with Epstein and Maxwell to NYC to see a show, stayed at Epstein's mansion, and was taken shopping for underwear.

events.title: Introduction to Donald Trump
events.description: Epstein took the victim in a dark green car to Mar-A-Lago to meet Donald Trump, introducing her as a friend.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and House Arrest
events.description: The victim recalls seeing news of Epstein's arrest and subsequent house arrest, which made her realize she was not his only victim.

events.title: Cessation of Contact
events.description: The victim stopped contact with Epstein and Maxwell after Epstein screamed at her for being ungrateful and after his attorney, Darren Indyke, contacted her about a debt.

locations: New York City mansion (Epstein's Manhattan residence)
Shutters on the Beach (hotel in Los Angeles)
Ralph Lauren store (mentioned in context of walks with Epstein)
keyFacts: The victim was 13 years old when first groomed by Epstein and Maxwell at a school camp in Michigan.
The sexual abuse began when the victim was 14 and involved both Epstein and Maxwell, later including other girls.
Epstein used financial payments ($200-$300 in cash), promises of modeling connections, and mentorship as part of the grooming and control.
The victim was taken to meet Donald Trump at Mar-A-Lago by Epstein, who introduced her as a friend.
Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, later contacted the victim claiming she owed Epstein $10,000 for a co-signed apartment, which was the last interaction she had with Epstein's circle.
